study_metadata.note: Diana used Matt Roumain's Xactimate login for most estimates. ALL jobs from Oct 2025+ are Diana's counting/estimating work.

jobs_studied.name: Schafer, Tyler
jobs_studied.notes: Most recent estimate. Kitchen scope limited to under-sink per scope note. Living room was extreme density with 20+ TAGs. No O&P markup. Flat rate $75/hr handling.
jobs_studied.visual_study_notes: Studied all 10 pages of walk-through. Kitchen: 15 photos but scope note says ONLY under sink. Dining: round table + 4 chairs + shelf unit + gallery wall. Living: PACKED - sectional, daybed, 3 cube storage units, TV, entertainment center, side tables, wall art. 50+ boxes of shelf contents. Pantry: packed shelves, all boxable. Linen: 4 shelves of towels/supplies.

jobs_studied.name: Huttie/Capitan
jobs_studied.notes: Luxury Scottsdale home. Room-by-room breakdown available. Uses LAB/LABS split billing. Fine art handling $9,000 allowance + firearms $750. O&P markup 10%+10%. Higher pad:TAG ratio due to luxury furniture.
jobs_studied.visual_study_notes: Studied all 16 pages of walk-through. Kitchen: ultra-minimalist, only countertops with sparse items. Dining: glass table + 6 modern chairs. Living+Formal: large open space with sectional, multiple tables, art. Formal Living: curved sofa, 2 accent chairs, side table. Bed 2: MASSIVE open shelving units loaded with decorative items (vases, globes, sculptures) = 32 boxes. Primary Closet: huge walk-in with floor-to-ceiling hanging clothes and shelves. Pages 15-16: close-up photos of decorative items on shelving (for inventory documentation).

jobs_studied.name: Clark, Stephen
jobs_studied.notes: Large 5-phase job. Farmers insurance. Includes packout report and cartage calculator.

jobs_studied.name: Goldman, Mike
jobs_studied.notes: Basement water loss. Billed hourly (T and M) not per-item. 245-page packout report with 620+ inventoried items. Different billing structure from later per-item estimates.

jobs_studied.name: Szymanski
jobs_studied.notes: Initial estimate + final. Two versions studied.

tags.definition: Items too large to fit in a box. Each piece of furniture counted individually.
tags.examples: Each chair = 1 TAG, table = 1, sofa = 1, sectional = 1, bed frame = 1, nightstand = 1, TV = 1, dresser = 1, shelving unit = 1, large art = 1
tags.not_tagged: Small boxable items, cabinet contents, clothing, linens, toiletries
tags.confirmed_by: Visual cross-reference of Huttie walk-through photos with room-by-room TAG counts

pads.definition: Furniture pads for items needing protection during transport
pads.gets_pads: Chairs, tables, sofas, dressers, nightstands, shelving units
pads.no_pads: Art/pictures (get bubble wrap), TVs (get TV boxes), rugs, lamps
pads.note: Luxury homes use extra pads per item. In Huttie, some rooms had more pads than TAGs (Primary: 14 TAGs, 21 pads).

boxes.definition: Estimated by contents volume in cabinets, drawers, shelves
boxes.notes: High-density packing is the default. Low-density used for loosely packed closets. Wardrobe boxes for hanging clothes.

examples: ONLY PACK OUT UNDER kitchen SINK - reduces kitchen to near-zero
Everything to come OFF WALLS - adds wall art to scope
DO NOT unplug items, H/O needs to unplug devices
scope_notes_critical.impact: Scope notes can dramatically reduce or expand room estimates. Must be factored in.

billing_evolution.oct_2025: LAB/LABS split billing ($58.70 LAB + $79.31 LABS). Gets flagged by insurance for supervisor costs.
billing_evolution.feb_2026: Flat rate $75/hr handling. Simpler, fewer insurance flags. ~63% margin.
billing_evolution.direction: Moving toward flat rate or raising base rates for everyone to avoid LABS flags.

vault_formula.furniture_policy: Do NOT stack furniture - prevents damage and allows billing more vaults
vault_formula.formula_note: Vaults driven primarily by box count. Furniture stored unstacked alongside boxes.

factory_standard_variations.what_varies: Per-TAG and per-box handling times in cartage calculator
factory_standard_variations.why: Site access complexity - stairs, distance to vehicle, heat, narrow hallways
factory_standard_variations.defaults: pad_wrap=8min, load_tag=3min, unload_tag=3min, move_tag=5min per TAG

schafer_comparison.note: Schafer test uses room-level overrides for extreme living room. Without overrides, lookup-only gives 23 TAGs (-25.8%).
